notesStmt.note: 2 leaves missing after folio 83 and another 2 after folio 87.
Tsemaḥ Menaḥem Yaḳini ben Yosef Yaḳini: inscribed in an entry on folio 1r.Johan de Puig: inscribed in a Spanish entry, folio 48r.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A festival prayer book for Rosh ha-Shanah and Yom Kipur, according to the Franco-German rite.

msItem.title: Services for the first day of Rosh ha-Shanah
Services for the second day of Rosh ha-Shanah

supportDesc.foliation: Parallel Hebrew foliation in Italian script up to folio 49r, and another from folio 49v to the end was added later.

collation.p: Quires of mostly 8 leaves each. Catchwords at the end of the quires, cut away for the most part.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Ashkenazi square and semi-cursive script, partially punctuated, with a number of notes in Italian scripts.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Mahzor. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2734.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Chaim M. Horowitz: purchased by the British Museum from him on 26 January 1884 (folio [167v])
